title: cmd_vel Atlas gliding slows down Gazebo over time

content.raw:
When controlling Atlas via the cmd_vel topic Gazebo slows down dramatically over time. When I try to move Atlas along the road in vrc task 1 I start with a real-time factor of 0.5 in the pen, by the time I reach the first corner it's down to ~0.22 and by the time I reach the second corner it's just 0.15 ... this does not seem to have a lower limit, I usually give up once it reaches 0.08 (or earlier).

This is not related to the world the robot is in as I'm also able to reproduce this by moving in a circle in an empty world. In an empty world however the real-time factor goes up to ~2.0 when I start moving the robot and within 20 second slows back down to ~1.0 and by the time sim-time hits 60 seconds I'm down to a real-time factor of ~0.23 ... stopping movement only causes very little recovery (e.g. it goes from ~0.23 to ~0.3 when I stop moving at ~0.23).

I was worried that this might also occur when the robot moves itself and I had it walk for ~50 meters or so but I did not see a change in performance so it only seems to be related to the teleportation movements that cmd_vel is using.

While this doesn't seem like too big of a deal it is fairly annoying for e.g. testing perception as it consumes more and more time the more you try to move the robot.
